Blog.post: Hmmmmm...I realized as I had mistakenly typed "a twitchy right eyelid brings good lunch" when I really meant to type "a twitchy right eyelid brings good luck". I think I will leave it though, just in case a twitchy eyelid can provide me with my afternoon meal.

Blepharospasm is the medical term for when your eyelid muscles repeatedly and rhythmically contract. Blepharo means "eyelid". Spasm means "uncontrolled muscle contraction". The term blepharospasm ['blef-a-ro-spaz-m] can be applied to any abnormal blinking or eyelid tic or twitch resulting from any cause, ranging from dry eyes to Tourette's syndrome to tardive dyskinesia. I have a twitchy eyelid. It's my left eye, and it began a couple of days ago. It was just my top eyelid, but now my bottom eyelid has decided to join in on the fun. It is indeed unfortunate, since I have read that a twitchy right eyelid brings good lunch, whereas a twitchy left eyelid brings only "doom". I can feel it coming, (the twitch, not the doom) my eye will squint up, and then..twitch twitch twitch twitch twitch. At this point, I will put my finger over my eye to calm the blepharospasm, and continue on with my day. I googled what I assumed to be the proper medical term "twitchy eyelid" and came up with this. I should sleep more, be leased stressed, and stop drinking caffine. I have drafted a letter to my boss to inform her that due to a medical condition, I will be unable to accept any work this week, and that I will need to be allowed to come in around lunch time and leave by 3:00. As for the caffine, well, that's just a chance I am going to have to take. Here it comes again...twitch twitch twitch.... I have to go by Publix at lunch and drop off a prescription at the pharmacy. Perhaps I will ask the pharmacist if he could recommend anything for a blepharospasm.

I did get some boiled peanuts on Friday. We stopped at a little road side stand and bought "a big ol heaping cup like 'at" for $3. The lady working the stand was super nice. When she was filling up the cup, she said "boy howdy, it sure is hot out here, don't you think? I sure would like to be out on a river boat fishing" I thought it was a wonderful idea. We were going to stop by her stand on the way home on Sunday, but she wasn't open. Besides, I had just eaten a bag of Hot Fries in it's entirity, so I was pretty full.
Back to work, back from the mountains. Can't think of anything nice to write, so I just won't say anything. Maybe once I wake up, I will have something to say.

So I woke up this morning at 3:00. And I don't mean I eased into an awakened state, I mean I woke straight up. I stayed in the bed for about half of an hour before I finally gave in and got up. I did 3 loads of laundry, cleaned the bathroom (and I mean really cleaned) changed all the sheets, and cleaned up a bunch of other crap. As I was cleaning, I was listening to a fabulous Vineyard CD, Dwell. Track # 8 is called Waiting on You Again. The chorus goes " Here I am....Here I am...Waiting on You again" and having never really payed attention attention to the rest of it, I thought "what a great thought, standing in wait for the Lord, waiting for him to tell you to move...that's how I want to be...waiting on His Word" It's at this point that I must interrupt myself to say I wonder why, out of all creation God would choose us. I suppose in His infinite wisdom, He realized we would be too stupid to do much by ourselves. Jesus told us to consider the lily, which did not toil and spin, yet Soloman, the king of Israel, in all his splendor was not clothed in as much beauty as the lily. I am sure if I had been standing there, He would have gotten as far as urlLink "Consider how the lilies grow. They ... Before I wandered off to pick flowers. My sister has a dog, named Miss Margaret. If you push her butt down to the floor, say "sit" and hand her a treat about five times, by the six time, you will probably be able to just say "Sit" and hand her the treat, and she will sit all by herself. I wish I were that easily trainable. I have to do something stupid about, oh, 76 times before I finally realize what I am doing. Thank you Lord that you chose us, otherwise... Anyways, back to the story. As I was folding the 2nd load of laundry this morning, I actually listened to the rest of the song. The first words? "I've been down this road so many times before. And here I am on this road again. I'm asking for Mercy, in spite of my sins. Oh Lord. You are the only one who loves me this way." It hit me like a ton of bricks. This song isn't about waiting for the Lord to move you. It's about how we sin and sin and SIN and SIN and SIN some more, and He just loves us and loves us and loves us some more. It's about confessing and waiting on His forgiveness. How selfish and proud I am. How very like me to take a song about the greatness of God's mercy and make it about what I want. How often do I expect someone to come and do penance for a wrong against me? How often do I want them to pay, and to feel badly, horribly for what they might have done to me? And yet, we are able to just stand at the feet of God and said "here I am. I'm asking for mercy." and He will put it as far as the East is from the West. What a mighty God we serve.

I am tired this morning. I don't know why. Maybe it is the fact that I have stayed up late the last 2 nights to watch the USA gymnasts take 2 silver medals. If I don't get enough sleep one night (and by enough sleep, I mean 8 hours) I turn really pissy. If I don't get enough 2 nights or more, I turn punchy and slap-happy. That is my mental state today. We had the nicest wiatress last night at Olive Garden. You see, I don't love Italian food, but Fitz does and we were celebrating his new promotion. So he got to pick. Anyways, I don't love Italian food, but Olive Garden has then great chicken fingers. I usually just get them on the appetizer plate, but the last time we were there, I saw some little kid with a plate of chicken fingers and fries. So this time, I asked Melissa, our super nice waitress if I could get that. She smiles and said "of course you can" and she didn't even make me feel stupid for ordering off the kids menu. I like that. We left her a huge tip.

Heather, Leana, Chris, Amy, Fitz and I played Texas Hold 'em on Saturday night. Amy and I are terribly similar. Our attention span is, oh, 15 minutes long. I can usually hold out a little longer, but Men's gymnastics was on NBC for the Olympics, and I just dropped all my candy in the pot and went to the living room to watch. We play with Starbursts and Hershey's miniatures. I found it rather difficult to play with Leana, because she is lactose intolerant, which means she can't eat chocolate. So she kept betting away all her Hershey's and her Reese's because she couldn't eat them. We didn't know if she was betting because she had a good hand or because she could eat the chocolate. Eventually Fitzy took it all. We took home a big bag of candy, and I ate it until I thought I was going to be sick. So I started working out again last week. I have read, and I believe it is true, that it is easier to stay motivated if you have a goal. So I thought I would get on a plan to train for a tiathlon. I found a 21 week program online. So I started training last week. And by training I mean running. And by running, I mean walking. My husband is very sweet and walks with me, even though my legs are about half the length of his and if he walks at my pace, he's is barely doing more than standing still. But, it is still sweet. I feel very icky this morning, and I am planning on working a half day. I got sick this morning, so I am drinking V8 Strawberry Kiwi Splash to try and replenish some of the good stuff I lost this morning. One of the instructors asked me if I was drinking a Bloody Mary. Yes. Yes I am. What a goober. It's 8 o'clock in the morning on a Monday and I don't EVER drink. Yes, this is a Bloody Mary.
